name: IniciaWindowsServices
description: Task used only to start Windows Services in remote Machines
author: Julio Arruda

inputs.name: runRemote
inputs.label: Run Remote
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable this option if this task need to run in remote servers. If you can use this in deployment group for example, disable this.

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide a comma separated list of machine IP addresses or FQDNs along with ports. Port is defaulted based on the selected protocol.
Eg: dbserver.fabrikam.com,dbserver_int.fabrikam.com:5986,192.168.12.34:5986
Or provide output variable of other tasks. Eg: $(variableName)
If you are using HTTPS, name/IP of machine should match the CN in the certificate.

inputs.name: AdminUserName
inputs.label: Admin Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Administrator login for the target machines.

inputs.name: AdminPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Administrator password for the target machines.
It can accept variable defined in Build/Release definitions as '$(passwordVariable)'.
You may mark variable type as 'secret' to secure it.

inputs.name: serviceName
inputs.label: Name of your Services to start
inputs.helpMarkDown: input the services name with coma separated

inputs.name: configuraUsuario
inputs.label: Change User Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Change the Login used in Windows Service

inputs.name: serviceUser
inputs.label: Service Login
inputs.helpMarkDown: Login used in your Windows Service

inputs.name: servicePassword
inputs.label: Service Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password Used in your windows Service
